name: Ramada Plaza Marco Polo Beach Resort

reviews.text: This hotel is not nearly as bad as the reviews. They really had us scared. Our room was nice and clean. The bathroom tub needed to be renovated and the hot water didn't last through all 4 of us. The closets were not renovated yet, but we didn't care. The prices for the amenities are the same as any Miami beach resort. We had a room with tile which is better than carpet for a beach resort. We were pleased and we would stay there again.
reviews.title: It was not bad....

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: the location is sort of in no-man's land -- close to nothing so you have to drive just to get decent food -- and you'll have to use the hotel's valet parking which is always a pain -- on the other hand, it's right on the beach! we loved that convenience, being able to take a dip whenever the mood hit -- the concierge was so nice (pro) but wasn't terribly knowledgeable about some common-sense stuff (con), like high waves cancelling snorkel boat trips -- staff and service was actually pretty good (pro) but tacking on an extra $10 a day "resort fee" is just that -- tacky! (con) -- this in addition to $18 a day for parking (and tipping every time they go get your car) is some serious gouging, we thought -- all in all, can't recommend it
reviews.title: pros & cons

reviews.text: The Ramada in north miami beach is a bit expensive and you have to pay for a lounge on the beach. $30 per day for 2 lounges and an umbrella. Also, the valet parking is a hassle. I found the staff to be extremely friendly. Everyday we saw Mary cleaning the floors and the bathrooms on our way to the pool. She's always smiling and the place was very clean. Edweena worked as a housekeeper on our floor. She was always chipper and also works incredible hard. As for the pool staff, Kelly always takes good care of the guests...He's also very kind and friendly. The only problem w/ the pool is security. The townspeople seem to always use the pool and they are not guests. it is a real problem. Why not have a gate that locks. When you come back from the beach, you can use your room key to open the gate. I've never been to a hotel that allows riff raff and kids to just come in an use the pool. Also, non guests valet park for $8 and come use the pool for the day. A lot of work for staff for no reason!
reviews.title: Friendly staff -terrible pool security.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My fiancé and I stayed here a couple of months ago as our "last vacation" before our wedding. We should have booked somewhere else after reading all of the terrible reviews, but since we have had luck two other times on this website, we decided to stay here anyways. I cringe every time I think about the hotel. Our room was HORRIBLE! There were bugs on the night stand on several occasions, and hair all over the bathroom upon arrival!!!! The balcony door didn't open or close properly and we couldn't leave it open at night because it rattled so hard we thought the glass was going to fall out. I was so grossed out by everything that I couldn't sleep. Talk about a NON-relaxing vacation! The hallways reeked of marijuana and cigarettes on several occasions, and the kitchenette including the refrigerator was really old and all rusty so I refused to keep anything in it. I wouldn't even walk on the carpet without sandals on because it was so gross, moldy and squishy. On top of there being bugs, the room was so old and dingy that I had to keep everything packed in my suitcase and set on the table over the course of 4 days when we were there because I was scared of bed bugs coming home with me in my garments! On top of this, the continental breakfast was disgusting. Talk about NO variety and BLAND! This vacation was a joke. It was more stressful getting through the nights than if I would have stayed home and worked! Oh, and be careful, if you can do without a car, DO IT! It is VERY pricey to park your car there overnight. I was really disappointed in this experience and we WILL NOT be returning here…not even if someone paid me.
reviews.title: HORRIBLE...BUGS!

reviews.text: I'm from NY and stayed at the Marco Polo Hotel for 9 days and had the best experience. Every night I had a drink at the bar in the Hotel and Marcelo made the best martinis. The martinis were better then all the NY bars and nightclubs. Marcello was very experienced, professional and made me feel very comfortable traveling alone. The bar was very clean and Marcelo the bartender was very friendly. Every night I had a different drink and would highly recommend visiting him at the Marco Polo lobby bar. Ask for the Best Apple Martini!
reviews.title: Best Bartender - Marcelo - TNT Bar
